result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Montejano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AS to Counts 1 and 2:
*Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 10/21/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 
*Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
Concurrent with: With count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: With count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Montejano

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 = $500.00 + $250.00) gj

Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 10/21/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Jose A Montejano in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Jose A Montejano in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, Count 3 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 1 & 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Jose A Montejano not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bench Warrant served.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. Defendant in warrant status. sab
Court actually ordered that the entire $750.00 cash bail be forfeited, not just $250.00. sab
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jose A Montejano in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jose A Montejano in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2 AND 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
